snippet: The House of Representatives ended the bill’s 14-year limbo over objections from the Catholic Church, which opposes provisions for sex education for schoolchildren and subsidized contraceptives.
abstract: Philippine lawmakers move ahead on bill that would mandate sex education in schools and subsidize contraceptives, despite opposition from the powerful Roman Catholic Church.
lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives ended the bill’s 14-year limbo over objections from the Catholic Church, which opposes provisions for sex education for schoolchildren and subsidized contraceptives.

headline.seo: Philippines Bill Would Improve Contraceptive Access
headline.main: Philippines Moves Forward With Bill to Improve Contraceptive Access
headline.print_headline: Philippines: Lawmakers Act On Reproductive Health Bill
